Upper, lower, and right margin are preserved.

According to [[Broomhead I]]: 137 "[w]ritten in small ductus, and clearly preserved it is the right edge of a large seven line manuscript."

[[Broomhead I]]: 139-140 translates:

a1 From the abrahmacārya, from the adattadāna, from robbery [and] from idle gossip,

a2 from ..., from unjustified accusation, from the state of the pretext [and] from the splitting of the saṅgha,

a3 The crimes will be attained (i.e. committed). Light [and] heavy [crimes]. This, I, the person called so-and-so,

a4 [or] [from sunrise], from the pure time [of penance] onwards up till this moment, or if the day is past ...

a5 The confession of sins is through compassion to be said a second and third time.

a6 ...: This one here, the monk named so-and-so, requests a confession.

a7 May he give the confession of the sthulāñca crimes. This ...

b1 Light [and] heavy [crimes]. He who ... the connected duṣkāra crimes ...

b2 [which] crimes may have been committed by me, from the time of penance till now.

b3 Having revealed ...: I see the good fortune [since] not having been able to control myself. You see ...

b4 the honourable saṅgha. I, the monk Dharmaśreṣṭi in this monastery of Śvetagira,

b5 request leave from the community for forty days to leave [and go out from] the boundary [of the saṅgha].

b6 In [his] own affairs, with ... the loving ...
